citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
One grey female cat "Poppyseed" has a matted hair coat with fecal material present. Three individual matts are present
on the cat's lower back across the spine each approximately one inch in diameter. At the base of the tail and under the tail
are several matts with dried fecal material present within them. Hair coats that are matted have the potential to cause skin
irritation, pain and discomfort. Hair coats must be maintained to prevent injury and illness to the cat.
This cat must be groomed by 9-October-2024.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The licensee is not conducting daily observations of all cats daily. The licensee states 9 adult cats housed in the isolation
and south buildings are checked on every other day. Failure to conduct daily observation of all animals does not ensure
that timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being can be evaluated and
addressed if needed. The licensee must conduct daily observations on all animals to assess their health and well-being.
To be corrected by: 3-October-2024
A female Balinese cat "Snowy" has a mild head tilt that has not been communicated to the attending veterinarian. The
inspector observed intermittent turning in large circles and when let out of her enclosure she walked straight with a mild
head tilt to the right. The licensee states this cat started exhibiting the head tilt in August but has not communicated this
health change with the attending veterinarian. Head tilt could indicate an underlying health issue and if left untreated could
result in the pain, physical or psychological distress or additional systemic problems. The licensee must have frequent
and direct communication with the attending veterinarian so that timely and accurate information on problems of animal
health, behavior, and well-being can be evaluated by the attending veterinarian. This animal must be evaluated by a
licensed veterinarian for an accurate diagnosis and to develop an effective treatment plan.
To be corrected by: 9-October-2024

The elevated resting surface in one enclosure housing one adult cat is in poor repair. The board supporting the resting
surface has split in half making the resting surface wobble back and forth when weight is distributed on each side. Lack of
well maintained surfaces can negatively impact the well-being of the animals as they provide the opportunity for the
species to exhibit some of their natural behaviors and decrease stress. Each primary enclosure housing cats must contain
elevated resting surface or surfaces that are impervious to moisture, easily cleaned, sanitized, or replaced when soiled or
worn, and large enough to hold all the occupants of the primary enclosure at the same time comfortably.
To be corrected by: 17-October-2024

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The litter boxes in the isolation and south building are not being spot cleaned daily to remove excreta. One adult cat had
dried fecal material present in the hair under her tail. An accumulation of excreta could cause the cats to become more
soiled, could attract pests, and could also increase the risk of disease. Excreta and food waste must be removed from
primary enclosures daily. The licensee must remove the feces from the affected enclosure and ensure that all waste is
removed from each enclosure daily.
To be corrected by: 3-October-2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
One grey female cat "Poppyseed" has a matted hair coat with fecal material present. Three individual matts are present

irritation, pain and discomfort. Hair coats must be maintained to prevent injury and illness to the cat.  
This cat must be groomed by 9-October-2024. 
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The licensee is not conducting daily observations of all cats daily. The licensee states 9 adult cats housed in the isolation 
and south buildings are checked on every other day. Failure to conduct daily observation of all animals does not ensure 
that timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being can be evaluated and 
addressed if needed. The licensee must conduct daily observations on all animals to assess their health and well-being.  
To be corrected by: 3-October-2024 
 
A female Balinese cat "Snowy" has a mild head tilt that has not been communicated to the attending veterinarian. The

3.6(b)(4) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The elevated resting surface in one enclosure housing one adult cat is in poor repair. The board supporting the resting 
surface has split in half making the resting surface wobble back and forth when weight is distributed on each side. Lack of 
well maintained surfaces can negatively impact the well-being of the animals as they provide the opportunity for the

species to exhibit some of their natural behaviors and decrease stress. Each primary enclosure housing cats must contain 
elevated resting surface or surfaces that are impervious to moisture, easily cleaned, sanitized, or replaced when soiled or 
worn, and large enough to hold all the occupants of the primary enclosure at the same time comfortably. 
To be corrected by: 17-October-2024 
3.11(a) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The litter boxes in the isolation and south building are not being spot cleaned daily to remove excreta. One adult cat had 
dried fecal material present in the hair under her tail. An accumulation of excreta could cause the cats to become more 
soiled, could attract pests, and could also increase the risk of disease. Excreta and food waste must be removed from 
primary enclosures daily. The licensee must remove the feces from the affected enclosure and ensure that all waste is 
removed from each enclosure daily. 
To be corrected by: 3-October-2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
